import { useState } from 'react' const Statistics = (props) => { console.log('ðŸ‘‰Statistics') console.log(props) let good = props.good return (

statistics

good {good}

neutral {props.neutral}

bad {props.bad}

all {props.good + props.neutral + props.bad}

average {((props.good + props.neutral*0 + props.bad*(-1))*100)/(props.good + props.neutral + props.bad)}%

positive {props.good*100/(props.good+props.neutral+props.bad)}%

) } const App = () => { // save clicks of each button to its own state const [good, setGood] = useState(0) const [neutral, setNeutral] = useState(0) const [bad, setBad] = useState(0) return ( <>

give feedback

) } export default App
